question.title: Change titlebar of java swing by FlatLaf causes entire UI change

answers.body:
You may try with JPanel. Set up the Flatlaf theme just for JFrame, and the JPanel will use a defined color.

import com.formdev.flatlaf.FlatMacDarkLaf;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.IOException;

public class Calculator {
    JFrame jf;
    Font digital;
    BufferedInputStream fontStream;
    JPanel mainPanel;

    public Calculator() {
        try {
            UIManager.setLookAndFeel(new FlatMacDarkLaf());
        } catch (UnsupportedLookAndFeelException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);

        // Font-related code stuffs...

        jf = new JFrame("Calculator");
        jf.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

        // Create the main JPanel
        mainPanel = new JPanel();
        mainPanel.setLayout(null);
        mainPanel.setBackground(new Color(0, 1, 1, 255));

        jf.setContentPane(mainPanel);

        jf.setSize(450, 650);
        jf.setVisible(true);
        jf.setLocation(455, 60);
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Calculator::new);
    }
}

You gave an incomplete code. I made some changes of your code. Follow the changes and make the changes in your real project.

Check out the link to know the difference between JPanel and JFrame. It will be useful to you when adding other components into your calculator.
